frclib

Class FrcCANSparkMax

  • java.lang.Object
    • trclib.TrcMotor
      • frclib.FrcCANSparkMax
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    trclib.TrcMotorController, trclib.TrcOdometrySensor

    public class FrcCANSparkMax
extends trclib.TrcMotor
    This class implements a SparkMAX motor controller by REV robototics. It extends the TrcMotor class and implements the standard TrcMotorController interface to be compatible with the TRC library. Reference manual of the motor controller can be found here: http://www.revrobotics.com/sparkmax-users-manual/?mc_cid=a60a44dc08&mc_eid=1935741b98#section-2-3

      • follow

        public void follow(trclib.TrcMotor motor)
        Description copied from class: trclib.TrcMotor
        This method sets this motor to follow another motor. This method should be overridden by the subclass. If the subclass is not capable of following another motor, this method will be called instead and will throw an UnsupportedOperation exception.
        Overrides:
        follow in class trclib.TrcMotor

                               trclib.TrcPidController.PidCoefficients pidCoefficients)

        Overrides:
        enableVelocityMode in class trclib.TrcMotor
        Parameters:
        maxVelocity - specifies the maximum velocity the motor can run, in sensor units per second.
        pidCoefficients - specifies the PIDF coefficients to send to the Talon to use for velocity control.

        public void disableVelocityMode()
        This method disables velocity mode returning it to power mode.
        Overrides:
        disableVelocityMode in class trclib.TrcMotor

      • setLimitSwitchesSwapped

        public void setLimitSwitchesSwapped(boolean swapped)
        This method swaps the forward and reverse limit switches. By default, the lower limit switch is associated with the reverse limit switch and the upper limit switch is associated with the forward limit switch. This method will swap the association.
        Parameters:
        swapped - specifies true to swap the limit switches, false otherwise.

      • configFwdLimitSwitchNormallyOpen

        public void configFwdLimitSwitchNormallyOpen(boolean normalOpen)
        This method configures the forward limit switch to be normally open (i.e. active when close).
        Parameters:
        normalOpen - specifies true for normal open, false for normal close.

      • configRevLimitSwitchNormallyOpen

        public void configRevLimitSwitchNormallyOpen(boolean normalOpen)
        This method configures the reverse limit switch to be normally open (i.e. active when close).
        Parameters:
        normalOpen - specifies true for normal open, false for normal close.

      • set

        This method sets the motor output value. The value can be power or velocity percentage depending on whether the motor controller is in power mode or velocity mode.
        Specified by:
        set in interface trclib.TrcMotorController
        Overrides:
        set in class trclib.TrcMotor
        Parameters:
        value - specifies the percentage power or velocity (range -1.0 to 1.0) to be set.

      • setBrakeModeEnabled

        public void setBrakeModeEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method enables/disables motor brake mode. In motor brake mode, set power to 0 would stop the motor very abruptly by shorting the motor wires together using the generated back EMF to stop the motor. When brakMode is false (i.e. float/coast mode), the motor wires are just disconnected from the motor controller so the motor will stop gradually.
        Parameters:
        enabled - specifies true to enable brake mode, false otherwise.

      • setInverted

        public void setInverted(boolean inverted)
        This method inverts the motor direction.
        Parameters:
        inverted - specifies true to invert motor direction, false otherwise.

      • setPositionSensorInverted

        public void setPositionSensorInverted(boolean inverted)
        This method inverts the position sensor direction. This may be rare but there are scenarios where the motor encoder may be mounted somewhere in the power train that it rotates opposite to the motor rotation. This will cause the encoder reading to go down when the motor is receiving positive power. This method can correct this situation.
        Parameters:
        inverted - specifies true to invert position sensor direction, false otherwise.

      • setSoftLimitEnabled

        public void setSoftLimitEnabled(boolean lowerLimitEnabled,
                                boolean upperLimitEnabled)
        This method enables/disables soft limit switches.
        Parameters:
        lowerLimitEnabled - specifies true to enable lower soft limit switch, false otherwise.
        upperLimitEnabled - specifies true to enable upper soft limit switch, false otherwise.

      • setSoftLowerLimit

        public void setSoftLowerLimit(double position)
        This method sets the lower soft limit.
        Parameters:
        position - specifies the position of the lower limit.

      • setSoftUpperLimit

        public void setSoftUpperLimit(double position)
        This method sets the upper soft limit.
        Parameters:
        position - specifies the position of the upper limit.
